text: Noel G. Williams (September 19, 1943 â€“ January 5, 2015), better known as King Sporty, was a Jamaican DJ, reggae musician, and record producer for the Tashamba and Konduko labels. He is best known for writing the song, "Buffalo Soldier", made famous by Bob Marley. He was born in Portland, Jamaica. Sporty died on January 5, 2015 in Miami, Florida, United States, aged 71. title: King Sporty
